meanings.definition: Having eyes that are partly closed in an effort to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: The man with squinty eyes tried to read the small print.
meanings.sent2: She always looks squinty when the sun is too bright.
meanings.sent3: The squinty cat tried to focus on the moving toy.
meanings.sent4: Her squinty gaze pierced through the fog of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The squinty expression on his face showed his concentration.

meanings.definition: A person with eyes that are partly closed in an effort to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: The squinty in the photo reminded her of her grandfather.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the squinty in the family due to his unique look.
meanings.sent3: The squinty at the party struggled to recognize faces.
meanings.sent4: She affectionately called him 'Squinty' for his constant gaze.
meanings.sent5: The squinty's glasses perched on his nose as he peered at the menu.

meanings.definition: To look at something with one or both eyes partly closed in an effort to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: She had to squinty to make out the distant road sign.
meanings.sent2: He squintyed at the tiny text to decipher the message.
meanings.sent3: The detective squintyed at the clue, trying to uncover its meaning.
meanings.sent4: The artist squintyed at the canvas, envisioning the final strokes.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, she squintyed to see the outline of the mountain.
